sorular.soru: Are short trips with a combustion engine passenger car comparatively better for the environment than long trips?

feedback.metin: An internal combustion engine must be warmed up to provide the best possible efficiency. The same applies to a three-way catalytic converter. Short journeys with an internal combustion engine passenger car are therefore comparatively more polluting than long journeys.

sorular.soru: Should you give way to the red car here?

feedback.metin: The driver of the red car is reversing out of the parking space and should give way to all other traffic. So they should give way to you. You are not obligated to wait. However, do make sure that the driver has seen you and stops in time.

sorular.soru: Are you driving in the right lane?

feedback.metin: This lane is closed. This is indicated by the red cross above the lane. So you are not allowed to drive here.

sorular.soru: Can you park here?

feedback.metin: Parking within 5 metres - approximately 1 car length - of an intersection is not allowed.

sorular.soru: Is a towed car seen as a trailer?

feedback.metin: If a passenger car is required to be towed, it will be regarded as a trailer. This does not mean that the towed car loses its status as a motor vehicle. A driving licence therefore remains mandatory.

sorular.soru: What is an indemnity certificate?
cevaplar: A document stating that you have paid the motor vehicle tax.
A document stating that the registration number of a vehicle is no longer in your name.
A document that the vehicle has passed the APK.
sorular.dogruCevap: A document stating that the registration number of a vehicle is no longer in your name.

feedback.metin: When you sell a vehicle, you transfer the vehicle’s registration number to the buyer’s name. You will then receive an indemnity certificate stating that the registration is no longer in your name, which means you can prove you are no longer liable for the vehicle.

sorular.soru: Can you stop here to make a phone call?

feedback.metin: You may not park next to broken yellow lines. Stopping is allowed, which means you can load and unload goods or pick up or drop off passengers. Making a phone call is categorised as parking, which is not allowed here.

sorular.soru: Can you reverse out of here?
cevaplar: You can reverse but you cannot turn.
You can turn but you cannot reverse.

feedback.metin: Reversing, turning or waiting is prohibited on autowegen and motorways. You may only use the hard shoulder, lay-by or the verge in emergency situations.

sorular.soru: What is the maximum allowed speed for a snorfietser?

feedback.metin: Snorfietsers may not travel faster than 25km/h.

sorular.soru: Is the expiration date of the APK on the vehicle registration card?

feedback.metin: The expiration date and other data about the APK (General Periodic Inspection) can be found on a separate inspection report. The report also states when the passenger vehicle must be reassessed.

sorular.soru: It is 1:00 PM. How fast are you allowed to drive here?

feedback.metin: You are driving on a motorway with a speed limit of 100 km/h at this time of the day. The lower sign indicates a speed limit of 90 km/h when the road surface is wet.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to overtake here on Tuesdays at 9:30 am?

feedback.metin: Lorries overtaking motor vehicles is prohibited at the times indicated on the sign. This only applies to lorries, not to buses. Lorries are also not allowed to overtake motorcycles. Because you are not driving a lorry, you are allowed to overtake when it is safe to do so.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to drop off passengers here?

feedback.metin: You are not allowed to drive, park, or stop on a bus lane. This lane may only be used by public buses.

sorular.soru: Who is allowed to go first?

feedback.metin: The black car is allowed first because it has the short turn. If drivers approach each other from the front and both want to turn into the same road, the driver turning right is allowed to go ahead of the driver turning left.

sorular.soru: Is a right wing mirror mandatory?

feedback.metin: Cars must have an inside mirror and a left and right wing mirrors.

sorular.soru: You want to leave the motorway. Where should you start braking?

feedback.metin: Unnecessary braking on the main carriageway is prohibited. Only use the brakes when you are on the deceleration lane and keep an eye on traffic behind you. When you start braking at the sign 'UIT', this will normally be too late.

sorular.soru: Is the verge a part of the road?

feedback.metin: Roads are all roads or paths that are open to public traffic, including the bridges and culverts therein, and the paths and verges or sides that belong to those roads. This means that a road is everything from ditch to ditch and from facade to facade. A pavement or verge is therefore also part of the road, just like a cycle path that is separated from the carriageway by a verge or pavement.

sorular.soru: How much longer does braking distance become if you double your speed?

feedback.metin: If you double your speed from 50 km/h to 100 km/h, the braking distance is not increased twice, but four times. The braking distance increases quadratically.

sorular.soru: What is this sign warning you of?

feedback.metin: This sign indicates a steep slope and is usually placed at the lowest point of that slope.

sorular.soru: What does this matrix sign mean?

feedback.metin: A white arrow on a matrix sign is pre-information of a red cross. This means that the lane must be cleared as soon as possible because it will be closed further on.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to overtake the moped like this?

feedback.metin: The F-1 sign indicates that motor vehicles may not overtake each other. Mopeds are not motor vehicles and may therefore be overtaken, if it is safe to do so.

sorular.soru: To which riders do these signs apply?
cevaplar: To moped and speed pedelec riders.
To moped riders, speed pedelec riders and snorfietsers.
sorular.dogruCevap: To moped and speed pedelec riders.

feedback.metin: These signs require moped riders to pass the sign on the side indicated by the arrow. Speed pedelec riders must adhere to the same rules as moped riders, so these signs also apply to them. These signs indicate that these riders must leave the carriageway and enter the cycle/moped path, or the other way around. Snorfietsers should follow the rules and signs of the cyclists, not the mopeds. So these signs do not apply to them.

sorular.soru: What is the quickest route to the centre?

feedback.metin: The time it will take to drive to the centre via the different routes is indicated on this board. The fastest route is via the s114.

sorular.soru: Can a trailer be fitted with both an emergency brake system and an auxiliary coupling?

feedback.metin: Trailers with a maximum authorised mass exceeding 1500 kg must be fitted with an emergency brake system to ensure the trailer applies the brakes if the tow bar breaks or comes off. Lighter trailers that are not fitted with an emergency brake system must be fitted with an auxiliary coupling. This steel ring ensures the trailer remains attached to the car if the tow bar breaks off or the trailer comes off. Because these two systems work against each other, to have both is not allowed.

sorular.soru: Can you drop someone off here?

feedback.metin: You may not park or stop on or within 5 metres of a crossing.

sorular.soru: What is the best behaviour in this situation?
cevaplar: Brake lightly to scare the tailgater.
Stay calm and merge to the right lane as soon as it is safe to do so.
Drive faster to create more space behind you.
sorular.dogruCevap: Stay calm and merge to the right lane as soon as it is safe to do so.

feedback.metin: Never feel rushed, and always stay calm. Maintain enough distance between your vehicle and the one in front of you. Make room as soon as it is safe to do so. Never use the brake to scare the tailgater. This can lead to serious accidents for which you will be held liable as you have unnecessarily endangered other road users.

sorular.soru: Should you give right of way to all traffic when you leave an erf?
cevaplar: No, you only have to give right of way to drivers.
No, you only have to give right of way to traffic coming from the right.
Only if it is designed as an exit construction.
sorular.dogruCevap: Only if it is designed as an exit construction.

feedback.metin: If the entrance or exit of an erf is designed as an entrance or exit construction, you are required to give right of way to all other traffic. That means both drivers and pedestrians.

sorular.soru: Can you use front fog lights in combination with sidelights?
cevaplar: No. Only in combination with full-beam headlights.
No. Only dipped headlights are allowed here.

feedback.metin: Visibility can be serverely obstructed in fog, snow and rain. You may then use the front fog lights. Front fog lights can be used in combination with sidelights or dipped headlights. It is also not mandatory at night when using front fog lights to use dipped headlights, because by reflecting in the fog, dipped headlights can cause glare to the driver. Sidelights are better in this situation.

sorular.soru: Does a passenger car need to have a reversing light?
cevaplar: No. This obligation only applies to heavy motor vehicles.
Yes. Passenger cars must be equipped with at least two reversing lights.
Yes. Passenger cars must be equipped with at least one reversing light.
sorular.dogruCevap: Yes. Passenger cars must be equipped with at least one reversing light.

feedback.metin: A passenger car must have at least one properly functioning reversing light and may have more than one.

sorular.soru: Is it mandatory to have a European claim form in the car?

feedback.metin: It is not mandatory to have a European claim form in the car. However, if there is an accident in which you are involved, it is useful if one of the two parties has a claim form with them. Then it is easier to handle the claim and pass it on to the insurance company. You only need one form per claim, consisting of an original and a carbonless copy paper. Fill in the front together and remember that both drivers must sign. Both parties will receive a page of the form. You then fill in the back of the form at home and send it to your insurer.

sorular.soru: What is the best course of action in the event of a strong crosswind?

feedback.metin: The biggest risk posed by a strong crosswind is that the wind pushes your vehicle to the left or right, forcing it off course. In this situation, you must lower your speed by releasing the accelerator and maintaining greater lateral distance. Bear in mind that you will need to countersteer against gusts of wind. This is most difficult when overtaking lorries and can even happen when driving under a viaduct. Wind bags or flags are placed in areas that see frequent gusts of wind, enabling drivers to anticipate gusts of wind and the direction from which they come.

sorular.soru: Under the 2toDrive scheme, are you also allowed to drive outside the Netherlands under supervision?

feedback.metin: If you fall under the 2toDrive scheme, you are only allowed to drive in the Netherlands under supervision. In that case, the driving licence is not valid abroad.

sorular.soru: What is the difference between being forbidden to drive and a disqualification from driving?
cevaplar: Being forbidden to drive only applies to driving motor carriages.
Being forbidden to drive only applies to driving motor vehicles.
Being forbidden to drive applies to driving all vehicles.
sorular.dogruCevap: Being forbidden to drive applies to driving all vehicles.

feedback.metin: If you are under the influence of alcohol and are driving a vehicle or are about to drive a vehicle, then you could be forbidden to drive. This prohibition applies to any and all vehicles, this includes bicycles, until you are sober again. If you are stopped when driving a moped or other motor vehicle, you can also receive a disqualification from driving. This means that you have to hand over your driving licence for a while. This also means that you can no longer drive any motor carriage that needs a valid driving licence. In that case, you are still allowed to ride a bicycle.

sorular.soru: What do you do first if you have a breakdown on the left lane of the motorway and you can no longer reach the hard shoulder while driving?
cevaplar: Turn on your hazard lights, get out, and cross to the hard shoulder.
Turn on your hazard lights, get out, and stand in the median.
Turn on your hazard lights and push the car to the hard shoulder.
sorular.dogruCevap: Turn on your hazard lights, get out, and stand in the median.

feedback.metin: If you have a breakdown on the left lane and you are no longer able to drive to the hard shoulder, turn on your hazard lights and position your car as close to the crash barrier as possible or in the median. Get out and stand in the median. Then call 112 immediately. Never cross lanes and never push your car to the hard shoulder.

sorular.soru: Should you use the open rush-hour lane?
cevaplar: No. The use of this is optional.
Yes. You are required to keep as far to the right as possible.
No. This is mainly intended for freight traffic.
sorular.dogruCevap: Yes. You are required to keep as far to the right as possible.

feedback.metin: If the rush-hour lane on the right is open, this means the hard shoulder is temporarily serving as the right-most lane. As a driver, you must stay as much to the right as possible, so you must use this lane if possible. Despite the amount of freight traffic using this lane, it is not solely intended for this purpose.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to park here?

feedback.metin: Waiting on the right-hand side of the road is prohibited. However, you may park on the left-hand side. You are not allowed to park in front of a driveway, even if it is your own driveway.

sorular.soru: What should you do if this light is on?
cevaplar: Stop immediately and call the breakdown service or garage.
Stop in a safe place and check the seat belts.
Nothing. The passenger airbag has been disabled.
sorular.dogruCevap: Nothing. The passenger airbag has been disabled.

feedback.metin: This light comes on when the passenger airbag has been disabled, which is mandatory if you have placed a child restraint system in the passenger seat facing away from the direction of travel. It is, therefore, safe to drive while this light is on. If an adult uses the passenger seat, re-enable the airbag.

sorular.soru: Are trams emergency vehicles?

feedback.metin: Trams are tied to a fixed path and therefore less manoeuvrable. Different rules therefore apply to trams. For example, trams always have right of way at equivalent intersections and you must always give way to deflecting trams. However, this does not make trams emergency vehicles. Emergency vehicles use (blue) optical and sound signals.

sorular.soru: The child is 1.50 metres. Is this the right way to transport this child?

feedback.metin: A three-point belt may not be used as a lap belt. Children smaller than 1.35 m must use an approved car seat or seat booster. Children taller than 1.35 m must use the seat belt whether or not in combination with a booster seat. The upper part of the belt must be placed across the front of the chest and over the shoulder.

sorular.soru: Can you overtake on the right here?
cevaplar: Only in case of a traffic jam.
No. Overtaking on the right is never allowed.
Yes. Overtaking is allowed in this lane.
sorular.dogruCevap: Yes. Overtaking is allowed in this lane.

feedback.metin: An acceleration lane, deceleration lane or combined acceleration and deceleration lane (weaving lane) is a section of road separated from the main carriageway by a block marking and intended for drivers wishing to enter or leave the main carriageway. To facilitate traffic flow, you may overtake to the right of the block marking.
